page.title: 02Place Name Origins
page.content:
There are 5 place names within our block.
1.{Thurcroft}:Thurcroft is a modern settlement which got its name from the Thurcroft family which lived at nearby Thurcroft Hall. 2.{Brookhouse}:Brookhouse comes from the first house on the site.This was built by the stream and was called Brook House. 3.{Laughton-en-le-Morthen}:Laughton was originally Leac-tun which meant 'herb-garden'.A morthen was a Saxon area of government. 4.{Brampton-en-le-Morthen}:The first spelling of this was 'Brom-tun' which meant 'farmstead in the broom'.The morthen is as in Laughton. 5.{Laughton Common}:This is a 20th Century settlement built on the original common land of Laughton.
